subject: Economics
title: Moore's Law: The Engine of Exponential Growth
description: A 60-second lesson on Moore's Law: The Engine of Exponential Growth.

hook.text: In 1965, Gordon Moore predicted transistor density would double every two years.

buildup.text: Moore's Law isn't physics ‚Äî it's economics. Chipmakers invest to double performance because the market rewards it.

discovery.text: A smartphone today has more computing power than NASA used to land on the moon.

twist.text: Moore's Law is slowing. Transistors are approaching atomic scale.

climax.text: Moore's Law taught tech companies to plan for exponential improvement.

punchline.text: For 60 years, computers got twice as powerful every two years.
